content.description: Start as for Morning Glory. When Morning Glory starts to cut left up the corner, Trail of Dawn goes directly up the overhanging wall above and finishes directly between the Morning Glory and Maritime Nation Anchor at a natural gear anchor

Start as for Morning Glory but instead of stepping up to the bolts continue up a corner with a finger crack. Make for the roof (2 bolts)pulling it on the left side. A groove leads to a two bolt anchor.
From the belay ledge, climb a ramp untill it steepens and then traverse left to a small stance below a large left facing corner. at the third bolt in the corner move left to the arete
content.protection: Nuts and small cams in addition to the few bolts makes this climb pretty well protected.   a few med-large cams for the semi hanging belay at the bottom.

content.description: From the right hand side of the belay ledge climb a short wall to a stance below a bolt. Climb left to another bolt, then up and left to another bolt. After that step left onto a right leaning ramp and climb up to ledge below the final head wall. Climb up the headwall (crux) to one more bolt and the top.
content.protection: Light rack because this climb is mostly bolted.

content.description: The corner just left of Morning Glory  It is the climb directly in line with the rap anchors. Start up left facing corner to small bulge and join Morning Glory. It is best to belay from the top.
content.protection: Toprope from two bolt anchor, also the rap station so be considerate.   Although I doubt that would be a problem as this area doesn't get a high volume of traffic.

content.description: From the middle of the starting ledge climb the steep finger crack, then straight up past 4 bolts to the top.
content.protection: Small cams and nuts in addition to the climb's 4 bolts make for adequate protection.  Two bolt anchor.

content.description: The left most route (facing the cliff) in the M.G alcove. Climb up to obvious groove, near the top of the groove step left onto the face. follow to top.
content.protection: Trad gear and two bolts. 1 bolt anchor can be backed up with gear.
content.location: From the top of the alcove locate the right most (facing ocean) anchor (1 bolt can be backed up with nuts) and rap in.

content.description: A small horseshoe shaped alcove on the right side of great head (looking at cliff from the ocean).
